sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Jacobus de Cessolis OP, Liber de moribus hominum et officiis nobilium ac popularium super ludo scaccorum. Miscellany of Moral, Devotional, Theological, Historical and Medical Tracts
Iac. de Cessolis. Miscellanea
msDesc.p: Vellum and paper, 292 203 11.6 x 8, ff. 1 + 191, double columns of 46 lines. Cent. xv, in a clear rather current hand.
Collation: 1 flyleaf, 112-512 6 (1-6 remain) 7 (two last remain) 812 912 (wants 12) 1012-1712 184, outer and middle sheets vellum, except 18 which is all vellum: the rest paper.

msItem.head: Jacobus de Cessolis OP, Liber de moribus hominum et officiis nobilium ac popularium super ludo scaccorum

head.title: Liber de moribus hominum et officiis virorum nobilium super ludo schacorum quem composuit frater Iacobus de Cesell [de Casulis] de ordine predicatorum

msItem.explicit: omne donum perfectum ipsi igitur sit honor et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit liber de moribus hominum et officiis nobilium transformatus in figuram scaccorum seu exemplum

head.title: Index of Liber de moribus hominum

lg.l: Egregium ludum scaccorum scire volentes
Cetera turba iacet nec habet quo rege regantur

msItem.head: John Waleys OFM, Communiloquium sive Summa collationum ad omne genus hominum (extract)

head.title: Quaedam moralitas de scaccario per dominum Innocentium papam

msItem.incipit: Mundus iste totus est quasi quoddam scaccarium
msItem.explicit: vel vite superbia

msItem.head: pseudo-Bernard of Clairvaux OCist, Epistola 256

head.title: Epistola beati Bernardi super re familiari gubernanda ad Raymundum gratiosum et felicem militem

msItem.incipit: Gracioso et felici Raymundo domno castri Ambrosii
msItem.explicit: dampnabilis senectutis

head.title: Narrationes devotae (some from Gregory the Great, Dialogi)

msItem.incipit: Rem vobis refero fratres quam fideli ac probabili ratione audiui de duobus ducibus
msItem.ab: Gregory and twelve pilgrims: a thirteenth appears
The source of many of these is Gregory's Dialogues. The 26th and last is

ab.decoNote: A man washes the feet of Christ appearing as a pilgrim

msItem.head: Martin of Braga, Formula uitae honestae
msItem.explicit: vel puniat ignauiam

msItem.head: pseudo-Seneca, De morum institutione
msItem.explicit: socios tue beatitudinis. Amen

msItem.head: Francesco Petrarca, Historia Griseldis

head.title: Historia sive fabula de nobili marchione Walterio domino terrae Saluciarum, quomodo duxit in uxorem Grisildem pauperculam, et ejus constantiam et patientiam mirabiliter et acriter comprobavit; quam de vulgari sermone Saluciarum in Latinum transtulit D. Franciscus Petrarcha

msItem.rubric: Dominus franciscus petrarcha transtulit de vulgari sermone saluciarum in latinum sequentem historiam siue fabulam de nobili marchione etc. ... comprobauit
msItem.incipit: Librum tuum quem nostro materno eloquio
msItem.explicit: quod pro suo mortali coniuge rustica hec muliercula passa est
msItem.rubric: Explicit Franciscus Petrarcha super historiam Valterii marchionis et Griseldis uxoris eius
msItem.ab: Petrarch, Opera 1554, p. 601 etc. Other copies in MS 275. 14, MS 458. 3

msItem.head: pseudo-Ambrose, Epistola de moribus et honesta uita

head.title: Tractatus Beati Ambrosii archiepiscopi de honestis et justis moribus

msItem.explicit: uidendo contempnas

msItem.head: pseudo-Anselm of Canterbury OSB, Meditatio unde uiuit anima et unde uiuit caro (medit. 5)

head.title: Meditatio Anselmi, unde vivat anima, et unde vivat caro, et de gloria bonae animae et de infelicitate malae animae quando exeunt a corpore

msItem.head: pseudo-Anselm of Canterbury OSB, Meditationes
Jerome, Aduersus Iouinianum (excerpt)

head.title: Excerptum Beati Hieronimi de libro Aurelii Theophrasti

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Aurelii Theofrasti de nupciis
Incipit illud quod excerpsit beatus Ieronimus de libro Aurelii Theofrasti de nupciis et posuit in libro 2o quem fecit contra Jouinianum
msItem.incipit: Festus Aurelius Theofrasti de nupciis in quo querit
msItem.explicit: usus relinquere. Hec theoffrastus secundum ieronimum ubi supra

msItem.head: Walter Map, Epistola Valerii ad Rufinum ne ducat uxorem (De nugis curialium, dist. 4, 3-5)
msItem.ab: In the lower margins of 83v to 85v

msItem.head: Caesarius of Arles, De ebrietate
Seneca, Epistulae morales (83, 16)
msItem.incipit: Non est animus in sua potestate ebrietate deuictus
msItem.explicit: si uis tibi uiuere

msItem.head: pseudo-Augustine, Sermo de honestate mulierum
pseudo-Augustine, De XII abusiuis saeculi (De duodecim abusionum gradibus)
msItem.explicit: sine uobis Christus incipiat esse in futuro

msItem.head: Hugh of Fouilloy OSA, De claustro animae (excerpt)

head.title: Hugo de Filiotto prior. canonicorum S. Laurentii in pago Ambianensi de Xll abusionibus claustri

msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Hugonis de xii abusionibus claustralium et est liber secundus de claustro anime
msItem.incipit: Sunt quid(am) qui sciunt et possunt
msItem.explicit: summa tocius religionis

msItem.head: John Grandisson, Vita Sancti Thomae Cantuariensis

head.title: Vita Beati Thomae archiepiscopi et martiris a Iohanne Grandesono episcopo Exoniensi

ab.quote: penitus excisa prima et ultima pagina exceptis

msItem.rubric: Prologus Archipresulis nec non et archimartiris
msItem.ab: Other copies in MS 275. 17, MS 464, MS 467
Resumes in Pars IV, cap. 5. Cap. 6 and last remains
msItem.rubric: Explicit vita gloriosissimi martiris Sancti Thome Cantuariensis Archiepiscopi

head.title: Miracle of St Augustine of Canterbury
Quoddam miraculum S. Augustini Anglorum apostoli

msItem.incipit: Est vicus in pago Oxoniensi vi miliaribus distans a loco qui dicitur Wodestoke
msItem.explicit: sine fine victurus intrauit. quod nobis prestare dignetur etc.

msItem.head: John Waleys OFM, Breuiloquium de uirtutibus antiquorum principum et philosophorum

head.title: Johannes Gallensis de ordine fratrum minorum, de virtutibus antiquorum

msItem.ab: enim (?) quomodo (?) neutrum daret. In denario Regem
msItem.explicit: qui dicit Ego sum via veritas et vita. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit tractatus de virtutibus antiquorum editus a fratro Johanne Gallensi de ordine fratrum minorum deo gracias

msItem.head: pseudo-Augustine, Epistula de transitu sancti Hieronymi (ep. 18)

head.title: Epistola Beati Augustini ad Cirillum de apparitione Beati Ieronimi

msItem.explicit: ora pro me

msItem.head: pseudo-Cyril of Jerusalem, Epistula ad Augustinum de transitu sancti Hieronymi

head.title: Epistola Cirilli Ierosolomitani episcopi ad Augustinum Hipponensem episcopum de miraculis Beati Ieronimi

msItem.explicit: precipua uiua manet

msItem.head: Peter of Blois, archdeacon of Bath, Compendium in Iob

head.title: Compendium Magistri Petri Blessensis super librum Job

msItem.explicit: me recolo vel legisse
msItem.incipit: Vir erat in terra hus etc. Adhuc tria hic ponuntur
msItem.explicit: altissimus altissimi filius Ihesus Christus qui cum patre et spiritu sancto triumphat et regnat in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: Ed. J. A. Giles, Opera Petri Blessensis III 19. P. L. CCVII

msItem.head: Richard Ullerston, De officio militari

head.title: Ricardus Ullerston, sacrae paginae professor, de officio militari ad regem Henricum V. tunc principem Walliae

msItem.explicit: potentes esse cum humilitate et pietate ipse dominus noster Ihesus Christus omnipotens vos esse concedat qui sine fine viuit et regnat. Amen

msItem.head: Peter of Blois, archdeacon of Bath, De transfiguratione Domini
msItem.incipit: Reuerendo domino et fratri karissimo fremaldo
msItem.explicit: requies et gloria sine fine. quam nobis misericorditer preparare et prestare dignetur qui etc.

msItem.head: Peter of Blois, archdeacon of Bath, De conuersione Sancti Pauli

head.title: Petrus Blessensis de conversione Sancti Pauli

msItem.explicit: ad reuelacionem glorie domini nostri Ihesu Christi cui est honor et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.head: John Ridewall OFM, Commentary on Epistola Valerii ad Rufinum

head.title: Expositio epistolae Valerii ad Ruffinum de uxore non ducenda

msItem.incipit: Loqui prohibeor etc. Hec epistola principaliter continet tria
msItem.explicit: tristis offendit corruptos

msItem.head: Andreas Didacus de Escobar, De schismatibus

head.title: Andreas episcopus de schismatibus quae fuerunt a fundatione ecclesiae ad annum Domini 1415

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Andree Ciuitatensis episcopi etc.
msItem.incipit: Sacrosanctum consilium Constantiense a. d. millo ccccmo xvo xvio et xvijo
msItem.explicit: durauit hoc scisma xli annis et sic est finis
msItem.ab: By Andreas de Escobar Bishop of Civitate and subsequently of Ajaccio. Cf. MS 151. 8

lg.l: Dum tenerent omnia medium (corr. to med. omn.) tumultum
Terminans in gloriam dei patris amen

ab.ref: Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 87

msItem.rubric: Incipit ludus fortuitorum et debet scribi in rotulo etc.

lg.l: Uos qui concupiscitis statum vestrum scire
Hec signa tractabitis que dant inuenire
Omnia que poscitis de vobis audire
Quid estis vel eritis hic est reperire

msItem.ab: Quatrains follow on Adam, Cain, Abel, Lamech, Noah, Canaan, Abraham, Ishmael, Lot, Lot's wife, Rebekah, Esau, Jacob, Leah, Rachel, Dinah, Joseph, Judah, Benjamin, Pharaoh's butler, Moses, Pharaoh, Jethro, Balaam, Joshua, Nachor (= Achan), Judah, Eglon, Gideon, Jephthah, Manoah, Samson, Ruth, Eli, Samuel, Saul, Jonathan, Goliath, David, Nabal, Uriah, Amnon, Hushai, Absalom, Barzillai, Joab, Solomon, Rehoboam, Elijah, Jezebel, Elisha, Gehazi, Josiah, Holofernes, Tobit, Vashti, Esther, Haman, Job, Daniel, Nebuchadnezzar, one of the wicked Elders, Mattathias, Tryphon, John Baptist, Mary, Herod, Magdalene, Zaccheus, Judas, the good thief, Paul, Ananias (and Sapphira)

These are all pairs of good and bad or successes and failures. One quatrain seems to be missing after the good thief: and in the cases of Job, Daniel etc., John Baptist and the Virgin etc., the two good and two bad are coupled instead of being alternated

lg.l: Derelicta repetit erit maledictus.
Explicit ludus fortuitorum siue fatorum

msItem.head: John Pecham OFM (attrib.), Defensio fratrum mendicantium

lg.l: O christi vicarie monarcha terrarum
Vir matris ecclesie sella scripturarum
Minister iusticie metaque causarum
mee querimonie aurem prebe parum
Hanc qui contra uenerint declaracionem
Incursuros nouerint se dampnacionem
Nec habere poterunt relaxacionem
donec plene fecerint satisfaccionem

head.title: Crux est denarii potens in saeculo

msItem.incipit: Crux est denarii potens in seculo
msItem.explicit: Summe mutabile fit necessarium

ab.ref: Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 223

msItem.ab: Various distichs in other metres follow
msItem.incipit: Manus ferens munera pium facit impium etc.
msItem.ab: Ends with pairs of lines on si dedero and ni dedero, ending

lg.l: Si dedero veneratus ero vocor et graciosus
Ni dedero diffamor ego vocor et viciosus

msItem.explicit: Et me christi manibus totum commendaui

ab.ref: Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 95

msItem.rubric: Lamentacio auctoris de miseria mundi et eius instabilitate

lg.l: Preda perquisicio sed lex ibi datur
Que dat unicuique prout operatur. Amen

msItem.ab: A last stanza added in lower margin
msItem.incipit: Fertur dies domini velut fur venire
msItem.explicit: Vt ad celi gloriam possit peruenire

ab.ref: Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 149

msItem.head: Aesop, Fabulae

lg.l: Attendite insule de longe venite
Et ysopi fabulas vigiles audite
Que sunt per methaforam recitate rite
Vos qui sermones nostros non vultis abite

msItem.ab: Last edited by Hervieux, Fabulistes Latins II 436, with readings from this copy. Ward, Catalogue of Romances II 342
msItem.rubric: de vacca capro et oue sociatis cum leone
de columbis eligentibus miluum in regem
msItem.explicit: Plaudens atque lupus ad pastorem veniebat
msItem.ab: As a rule each quatrain ends with a hexameter

msItem.head: Geoffrey of Monmouth, Historia regum Britanniae (extract)
msItem.incipit: Ab origine mundi circa annos tria milia et nungentos septuaginta
msItem.explicit: ex eorum nomine britanniam vocauerunt

head.title: Chronica bona et compendiosa de regibus Angliae
Chronica bona et compendiosa de regibus Angliae a Noe usque ad hunc diem, [1377]

msItem.ab: Ends 213v with coronation of Richard II, 1377

msItem.rubric: Hii fuerunt pontifices Rome summi Regum predictorum tempore
msItem.ab: On 213v is scribbled (xvi) the name Thomas Sheldone

head.title: Catalogue of royal saints of England

msItem.ab:
References to the Polychronica are given throughout. The other sainted kings are:
Sebert, Edwin, Oswald, Oswin, Ethelbald, Alfwold, Ethelbrihgt, Kenelm, Fromund, Edmund, Edward, Edmund Ironside, Edward Confessor, Edward II

head.title: List of persons who assisted William the Conqueror in the invasion of England
Nomina [eorum] quorum ope et auxilio dux Willelmus conquestor terram Angliae conquisivit A.D. 1066

msItem.explicit: Straunges, Sauage. Istorum fortunata milicia fuit terra anglica conquisita
msItem.ab: A note on reckoning of Anni Domini

msItem.head: Herbert of Bosham, Thomus (extract)

head.title: Causa exilii et martirii Beati Thomae martiris et pontificis Cantuariensis

msItem.incipit: De aduocacione et presentacione ecclesiarum etc.
msItem.explicit: nati esse dinoscuntur. hoc xvi tolerauit

msItem.head: Hugh of Saint-Victor OSA, De sacramentis legis naturalis et scriptae dialogus
msItem.incipit: Quid fuit priusquam mundus fieret ? R. Solus deus.
msItem.explicit: Hoc dei iudicio mihi relinquendum videtur
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt loca egiptus desertum et terra promissionis
msItem.explicit: natura sumus filii ire

msItem.head: Gaufridus monachus (attrib.), De corpore et sanguine Domini

quote.q: Hic Gaufridus ut apparet ex chronicis D. Antonini fuit primo discipulus cujusdam Petri Abelardi, quo cum D. Bernardus conflictabat, et idem postea relicto heretico ad Bernardum perfugit, cujus erat diu notarius, qui postea scriptis redarguebat preceptorem hereticum : vixit A.D. 1144

msItem.incipit: Gaufridus peccator in presenti tractatu Catholicus scriptor
msItem.explicit: Factus conscendit Judex venturus in orbem

msItem.head: Honorius Augustodunensis, Elucidarius
msItem.explicit: videas bona ierusalem omnibus diebus vite tue Amen. Ihesu mercy
Matthias: cui datur euuangelica predicacio in iudea etc.
msItem.incipit: Solus enim Matheus ebraice scripsit in iudea Marcus grece in Italia etc.
Hic matheus agens hominem generaliter implet etc.
Petrus et Andreas ex uno patre fuerunt etc

head.title: Cur mundus militat sub vana gloria
De vanitate et brevitate mundanae gloriae

msItem.incipit: Cur mundus militat sub uana gloria

lg.l: Fac bonum omnibus quamdiu poteris
O quam iocundum quam dulce foret dominari
Si mors non posset dominantibus insidiari.
Sed quia mors semper comes est et causa doloris
Non honor est sed onus assumere nomen honoris

msItem.ab: Cf. Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 147

msItem.head: Henry of Avranches, Disputatio inter cor et oculum
msItem.incipit: Quisquis cordis et oculi non sentit in se iurgia
msItem.explicit: Nam cordi causam imputat, occasionem oculo

ab.ref: Wright, Poems of W. Mapes, p. 93

head.title: Lamentatio et deploratio pro morte, et concilium de vivere Deo

msItem.incipit: Dum mortem recolo crescit mihi causa doloris
msItem.ab: In the distichs beginning Vado mori the following are the speakers: Papa, Rex, Presul, Miles, Monachus, Legista, Jurista, Doctor, Logicus, Medicus, Cantor, Sapiens, Diues, Cultor, Burgensis, Nauta, Pincerna, Pauper, Elemosinarius

lg.l: Nulli mors parcis concludens singula fine
Omnia transibunt preter amare deum

msItem.explicit: Non potes ante deum viuere preter eum
msItem.ab: Cf. E. M‚Äöle, L'Art religieux de la fin du moyen ‚Äöge en France, 1908, p. 392 note. He calls attention to the poem as an early form or sketch of the Dance of Death

msItem.head: pseudo-John Pecham OFM, Speculum miseriarum senectutis
msItem.incipit: Dum iuuenis creui ludens nunquam requieui
msItem.explicit: Tam ducibus quam principibus communis habetur

msItem.head: Philip Eton, De aetatibus hominis

head.title: De etatibus hominis per M. Ph. Eton.

msItem.incipit: Duxit natura de semine me genitali
msItem.ab: A quatrain on each age. Nascens, Infans, Puer, Adolescens, Iuuenis, Vir, Senex, Decrepitus, Mortuus

lg.l: Cuncta virencia flore nitencia more notato
Deficiencia sunt et olencia fine probato

msItem.head: pseudo-Augustine, Speculum peccatoris
msItem.incipit: Fratres karissimi quam tremenda est dies ilia
msItem.explicit: largitate redimere prestante domini nostri Ihesu Christi qui cum etc.

msItem.head: pseudo-Bartholomaeus de Ferraria, De regimine sanitatis
msItem.incipit: In isto tractatu qui intitulatur de regimine sanitatis
Oportet ipsum qui vult esse longeuus
msItem.explicit: persecucionem non euadent

msItem.incipit: Nota quod calidum in primo gradu

msItem.head: Avenzoar, Liber de conseruatione corporis humani (transl. by Arnold of Villanova)

head.title: Liber de conservatione corporis humani et regimine sanitatis sapientissimi senis Arabici Albenzohar translatus ab Arnaldo de Villa Nova A.D. 1368

msItem.explicit: debet sufficere cum dei adiutorio

msItem.head: Arnold of Villanova, Commentum super regimen Salernitanum
msItem.rubric: Hoc opus aptatur quod flos medicine vocatur
msItem.incipit: Anglorum regi scripsit scola tota salerni
msItem.explicit: Ista super renes pecten pone sitque iuuamen
msItem.incipit: Sume cibum modice modico natura fouetur etc.
msItem.ab: Cf. Dr Norman Moore, The Schola Salernitana (Finlayson Lecture), Glasgow, 1908
